resources.string:
Active vitamin D controls the balance of calcium, phosphorus and PTH.
Vitamin D is responsible for:
-Building and maintaining strong bones -Keeping the right level of calcium and phosphorus in the blood
-Preventing bones from becoming weak or malformed
-Preventing rickets in children and osteomalacia in adults
Maximum intake is 25 mcg (1,000 IU) for infants and 50 mcg (2,000 IU) for children and adults with normal kidney function.
